case_vignette: A 63-year-old man comes to the physician because of increasing generalized fatigue for 3 months! He is having more difficulty with keeping up with his activities of daily living and has lost 2!5 kg (5!5 lb) over the past month! He has hypertension and hyperlipidemia! He does not smoke and drinks two to three beers on weekends! His medications include lisinopril, hydrochlorothiazide, and atorvastatin! His temperature is 37!1°C (98!8°F), pulse is 85/min, respirations are 15/min, and blood pressure is 125/73 mm Hg! Examination shows pale conjunctivae! The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities! His hematocrit is 27!3%, leukocyte count is 4500/mm3, and platelet count is 102,000/mm3! A peripheral blood smear shows numerous blast cells that stain positive for myeloperoxidase, CD33, and CD34!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have been experiencing increasing generalized fatigue for the past 3 months and have lost about 5.5 pounds over the last month.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, night sweats or easy bruising?
No, I haven't noticed any of those symptoms.
Do you have any existing chronic health conditions or are you currently on any medications?
Yes, I have hypertension and hyperlipidemia, and I am currently taking lisinopril, hydrochlorothiazide, and atorvastatin.
Is there any family history of cancer or blood disorders?
I'm sorry, but there's no information provided about my family history in this context.
Have you noticed any changes in your appetite or digestive issues recently?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my appetite or digestive issues.
Have you experienced any enlargement of lymph nodes, or noticed any unusual lumps on your body?
No, I haven't experienced any enlargement of lymph nodes or noticed any unusual lumps.
Have you had any recent infections or illnesses?
No, I have not had any recent infections or illnesses.
Have you had any laboratory work or imaging done recently regarding your symptoms?
Yes, I had some laboratory work done which showed a low hematocrit, low white blood cell count, and low platelet count. A peripheral blood smear was also performed showing numerous blast cells.
Final Diagnosis: Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML)
